alert.note: Alert for Eastern Gifford Pinchot NF - Mt Adams Ranger District; Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 03 at 3:33PM PDT until July 05 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a Red Flag Warning for significantly unstable conditions, which is in effect until 11 PM PDT Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 660 AND 663... * AFFECTED AREA... In Washington -Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills -Fire Weather Zone 663 Eastern Gifford Pinchot National Forest Mt Adams Ranger District. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum RH as low as 15-20 percent each afternoon. Lowest humidity in the valley bottoms and near the Columbia River Gorge. Poor to moderate RH recoveries overnight ranging from 35-60% with the lowest RH in the valleys. * HAINES...5 (Moderate due to drying) to 6 (high). * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid spread on any new or existing fires. Extreme fire behavior is possible, especially from established fires. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Gifford Pinchot NF - Mt Adams Ranger District; Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills
